intro: Turraea pevelingii, commonly known as the African turraea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their potential healing properties. Turraea pevelingii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
